page.title: 07BOATING IN LERRYN
page.content: Adjacent to the river in{Lerryn there is a village green and a car park. This makes it a very popular spot for picnicers and people who wish to launch small boats, when the tide allows. Groups of disabled visitors come from{Churchtown Farm field centre at{Lanlivery,}as it is easy to move disabled adults and children from their mini-buses into their boats. Several boats have their moorings at{Lerryn,}but they can only be used for two hours either side of high water, for the rest of the time they are stranded on the mud. Boat owners often take their boats down river on one tide and bring them back on the next. Visitors should note that at high water, on spring tides, the roads next to the river in{Lerryn and Golant}and the car park in{Lerryn}flood!
